case_title: SURYABALI and others vs THE VITH ADDITIONAL DISTRICT JUDGE, DEORIA and others
reference_no_or_id: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No. 9631 of 1988
respondant: THE VITH ADDITIONAL DISTRICT JUDGE, DEORIA and others
complaint_summary: The petitioners sought to quash orders dated 24-2-1987 and 9-3-1987 passed by the Munsif, which denied adjournment to the defendants for producing evidence and dismissed their application for restoration.
investigation_summary: The procedural fairness was questioned as the Munsif closed the evidence of the defendants without granting sufficient time or following the provisions of Order 17, Rule 3 of the Civil Procedure Code.
judgment_summary: The court quashed the impugned orders, directed the Munsif to grant short adjournments for objections and evidence production, and mandated disposal of the suit by 31-3-1989.
legal_arguments: Violation of procedural fairness under Order 17, Rule 3 of the Civil Procedure Code.
Principles of natural justice, including audi alteram partem, were not adhered to.
The court emphasized the importance of granting reasonable adjournments to ensure justice.
key_issues: Whether the denial of adjournment violated procedural fairness.
Whether the principles of natural justice were adhered to.

maxims.audi alteram partem: The right of a party must not be affected without affording them an opportunity of hearing.
maxims.Qui aliquid statuerit parte inaudita alt: Justice should not only be done but must manifestly appear to have been done.

legal_terms.adjournment: Postponement of court proceedings to a later date.
legal_terms.casus omissus: A situation not provided for by statute.

words_and_phrases.procedural fairness: Adherence to rules ensuring fair treatment in legal proceedings.
words_and_phrases.natural justice: Legal principles ensuring fairness and equity in judicial processes.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around procedural fairness and adherence to natural justice principles under Order 17, Rule 3 of the Civil Procedure Code. The court quashed the impugned orders and directed the Munsif to grant adjournments for objections and evidence production, ensuring the suit's disposal by 31-3-1989.
